name: Hotel Le Soleil

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a Friday & Saturday night for a special occasion with my wife. We had a regular room (not a jr. suite or suite) and the room was a nice size and clean. The view wasn't great, looking out from the back of the building and over the back of a bistro behind the building, but we weren't expecting a view so that wasn't a large negative. We would occasionally hear large numbers of bottles being emptied into the dumpster and the trash collection (and we were over 5 floors up). The room has a wall paper pattern of vertical stripes, and while elegant, there were a couple of edges where it seemed to be slightly peeling, not exactly what I would expect in a hotel of this grade.
reviews.title: Nice, but not great

likes.disliked: — not what I would expect for a 4-5 star hotel room and some service personell were unacceptable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for service personell, the first bellman and valet I met upon checking in were very pleasant and professional, as was the front desk clerk, but not everyone maintained this professionalism. The front desk personell were attentive and professional (and assisted me with a dinner reservation when the concierge was not present). The bellman and car valet, not so much. I later called the front desk to inform them I needed to retrieve something from my car, and she said she would have th car brought up. The car was brought to the front and I retrieved what I needed from the car and was informed by the bellman if I needed to retrieve something from the car he could just let me into the private garage. I didn't argue with him that I had told the front desk clerk I only needed to retrieve something from the car.
reviews.title: Lovely quiet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Additionally, when we were ready, I stood for a couple of minutes at the bellstand while the bellman and valet just talked outside (not helping any guests). When I walked out and got their attention to retrieve my bags (from checked storage) and my car (from the garage), the car was brought around well enough, but rather than bring the bags out to my vehicle (where I was standing), he just dumped them next to couch inside where my wife was sitting and didn't offer to bring them out the vehicle, etc.
reviews.title: Great way to end a cruise!

likes.disliked: — Only got to stay one night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of the hotel for me was definitely the central location and walking distance to many sites and restaurants, great since we are both explorers and enjoy touring cities by foot or using public transportation.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but watch out when parking your car!

reviews.text: Situated in a very quiet location,10mins walk from cruise terminal and very handy for any sightseeing.Very friendly staff.Very clean,comfortable and spacious.We were upgraded to a corner suite,2 Queen beds,large TV in bedroom and lounge.Tea/coffie making facilities.Bakery and small deli nearby on the way to cruise terminal which was handy for breakfast.
reviews.title: wonderful experience!

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for one night because our daughter got married in Vancouver, didn't want to drive home late. Reviews for this hotel were great, the decor was very nice, makes you feel like you stepped into Europe, but I was a little disappointed.
reviews.title: A little bit of Europe

reviews.text: I paid extra to have a corner suite, which was very small, and had a dismal view of a narrow view of rooftop and aircons. The clincher for me, why I will not go back, was the amount of dust that wafted off the draperies when I moved them. Not a good sign of cleanliness policies! I did email the hotel about this, but did not receive a reply at all.
reviews.title: Small hotel, great service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So for all you people allergic to dust, don't go!!
reviews.title: Good location, nice rooms, a bit of attitude
Loved it!
reviews.text: There is a good reason Le Soleil is rated in the top 5 in Vancouver. A smaller hotel, close to the waterfront and Gastown, fair priced, with friendly, helpful service. The rooms are suite-like, bedroom, sitting room, 2 televisions, comfortable bathroom. There are special packages that make Le Soleil more affordable than many larger chain hotels. Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Know that while Vancouver prepares for the 2010 Winter Olympics, visitors will encounter construction everywhere.
reviews.title: great hotel in heart of Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot believe some of these reviews!Simply because our stay was a fiasco.The room & service at the front desk, ordering room service at dinner time was I was so rushed by whoever took the orders by phone, that of course what arrived was not entirely what we ordered.The concierge seemed busy , reading the paper as we passed by him to hail our cabs.Food was mediocre and service to rooms til 10pm.Last , but not least the "kama sutra"basket with condoms and lotions as well as oxygen to purchase , left me cold.I have never experienced this at The Four Seasons..wish we had stayed there, but the reason we did not was that we had stayed 6 years ago at Le Soleil, how time has changed what used to be a classy place! Make sure if you want a "do not disturb "on your phone to ask for it VERY clearly...I was awakened by a loud ringing phone 20 minutes after my request.The sun did not shine @Le Soleil for us.
reviews.title: No Sun @ Le Soleil for us....

likes.disliked: — Most everything!Old cushions, old bed , needs revamping, smells musty...I wonder if they will spruce it up before 2010!?

reviews.text: I love this hotel. The service is great and the property is fabulous! The decor is colorful and cheery -- what a treat. Good sized rooms; unlike some reviews below, I did not find the bed hard--it was just fine! Lovely linens and fine Aveda toiletries. I am so glad I found this hotel--I will stay here whenever I am in Vancouver.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel

likes.liked: — The decor and great service; free wireless internet

reviews.text: This was my first time staying at Le Soliel and will certainly not be my last. From the nicely appointed lobby with a couple of comfortable lounge areas to the fantastic one bedroom suite visitors are engulfed in chic Euro style. The staff was also to the European standards of excellence where hoteliers hold their professional positions as full careers.
reviews.title: Shining brightly at Le Soleil

likes.disliked: — My room had not too great of a view but not too bad

reviews.text: The hotel location was right in the middle of the city which was convenient for walking to most of my meetings but also nice for window shopping and going to one of the many fine coffee houses which seem to be every 20 feet.
reviews.title: Nice boutique with better than expected service

reviews.text: You cannot go wrong staying at this hotel, I highly recommend it. It fits well within the lovely city of Vancouver.
reviews.title: Loved the Le Soleil

likes.liked: — Location and value for the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel is a little hard to find, but worth the effort! we had never before had a concierge order us a special, "on the house" appetizer after making our dinner reservation. the staff went over and above expectations. everyone is so well coached- from the maintenance man in the elevator to the valet parking the car. the rooms could use a little updating with their heavy bedspreads and drapes looking out of fashion, but we would definitely come back.
reviews.title: what a staff!!!

reviews.text: I agree with the recent posts. I paid $250/ night + taxes for the lowest tier of rooms available (tiny room, king bed only). The room itself was moderately dated, with an old-school bedspread (Note - Who uses bedspreads anymore? Everyone has white duvet covers now !!!).
reviews.title: Meh - Just Ok

likes.disliked: — Inflated prices, dated and small room

reviews.text: I was on the 9th floor and looked directly into the YMCA daycare next door. The service at check in was average - everyone was polite and nice but there was nothing outstanding about my experience. They had Aveda products in the rooms but the best part about this place is the location - it is close to everything, including Robson Street. At the same time, most of the major chains are located in downtown Vancouver and their location would be equally serviceable.
reviews.title: Good enough for me but not one for all.....

reviews.text: I was disappointed by the lack of services available, all the while acknowledging that this is a "boutique" hotel. There was no internet and you had to pay to use the gym facilities at the YMCA next door. When I was asking for a good sushi restaurant, the girl at the counter referred me to a ghetto sushi place around the corner. All she had to do was tell me to go to Denman Street!!
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: An average place for a fairly high price. If I were to do it again, I would just as soon book into the Westin or the Hyatt down the street, which are comparable in terms of prices. It was an alright hotel but don't go there expecting that it's THAT great. The previous posters who waxed eloquent about this place were off the mark about Hotel Le Soleil.
reviews.title: Overrated and without much in the way of amenities

likes.disliked: — Ignorance, rudeness of staff Ridiculous rates and inability to reconcile with Hornby Hotel

description: Designed with a European influence and attention to details have given the Executive Hotel Le Soleil a well deserved reputation as one of the top hotels in downtown Vancouver. Our large suites, attentive staff and great location make a visit to the beautiful City of Vancouver an exeperience to remember. We are always available to answer questions about the city, hotel and other Executive Hotel Properties.
